ratings.comment:
Engl4376.  Don't do it.  
I wanted to like & be nice to this guy.  He's only taught at UT for a year.  Omg.  He teaches the textbook.
His instructions can be vague and then he'll message you asking why you didn't do what he wanted.
He talks like we're supposed to understand graduate terms.  I hardly learned anything.  I'm sure he's a great person..

Enjoyed class very much. Lectures were often interesting and engaging rambles on other topics not always related to class material. Gave genuinely good feedback on essays and made a great effort to get to know you as a person and help you succeed. Super nice and relatable. Would take any class he teaches.

Brandon is okay. He is engaging and funny but I did not learn anything in class. All we did was go over homework which did not help at all. Also a bit disorganized and his instructions are often vague.
Mr Goodale was extremely active in trying to connect with his students and create an inclusive learning environment.
Brandon is literally my favorite teacher. Online school isn't fun but he keeps everything really entertaining and makes Spanish one of my favorite classes.
He keeps content interesting as well as thoroughly makes sure we understand the content.

Never clear about grammar rules or usage and gave wishy washy instructions for assignments. Had long boring lectures during which he would go on unhelpful tangents and would call on people randomly when they were clearly lost and needed help, which was embarrassing and unprofessional. Pronounced "haya" as "hasha" which confused many people.

Never knew what was going on. Very unclear with directions and tests were always very vague. He would refer you to the textbook when you asked him questions instead of answering them for you and was little help because of it. Wasted class time with grammar that was never on tests and called on random students all the time. Not a fun semester.

Brandon ruined spanish for me. Planned on minoring, ended up stopping spanish after this class. He never knew what he was teaching. Often said "yeah either answer could work," but then would not give points back. Also had no idea what would be on our tests and after viewing them say, "that was unfair." Dreaded going to this class 4x a week.

Do not take a class with him! He is unknowledgeable about the content and often answers questions with "Oh yeah that could probably work too" when there is only one right answer. When going through exams he often got questions wrong. The class course load isn't a challenge, but the exams make it hard to get an A due to very vague directions.

Brandon was a hilarious teacher for span 203. I thought he was hilarious and caring. Spanish 203 is really easy if you just do the work, and his method of lecture/practice is effortful and effective. I really felt like he cared about my success

Brandon made the class fun and engaging. Great energy in general, especially for a night class. He was relaxed and funny. This class focused on grammar in reading, writing, and speaking. He presented the materially clearly and managed the class effectively. His Spanish is excellent. I really enjoyed having him as an instructor.

The professor was given the course structure and reworked it as the semester went along to improve the course design. As an intro course it was a lot of new info. He changed the homework format for the later chapters to be more useful, which I liked. He shared all the PowerPoints and exam formats with us online which was very helpful. Taken at UWM.

Goodale is a nice guy, a little nerdy but I struggled in his class. I'm a great student especially in Spanish but SPAN 341 at UWM with him was impossible. He would put 200 words on a slide, talk very quickly, and wouldn't distinguish what information was extra and what was necessary to memorize. All over the place!

He's super chill and would totally help outside of class if you have any problems. He does grade a little bit harder than my Spanish 203 class. Study ALOT for the first exam because almost everyone does bad on it and it sucks to start off bad. 2 speeches, 2 papers, 6 tests, 1 final, ch hw, participation, and some busy work added in is the layout.

Brandon is fun to be around and makes the class more enjoyable. He never fails to make you laugh and teaches the course well. The class has a lot of work involved and there is an exam every two weeks. Make sure to attend his office hours if you feel like your behind. He is very approachable and cares about his students!

I really liked using movies as a way to learn about different places together with the in-class discussion. I loved looking at the different places to go in South America. I also enjoyed learning about the use of 'vos' in South America. My favorite part of the course were the almost daily presentations. They helped me break out of my nervousness.

I learned a ton in this Summer class and that I definitely improved my Spanish. It was a 3 credit class condensed into 4 weeks so it was intensive, but worth it. Make sure to stay on top of projects/homework so you don't fall behind. There were some minor kinks but those got worked out and can be expected in a brand new class. Overall good course!

It was a 4 week summer class but had far more work than any other class I've taken during my whole undergrad. Tons of busy work that was very unnecessary. The final project was an absurd amount of work. Mine was 55 pages long and very detailed and I got many points taken off of it. Very disappointed to put so many hours and not see success.
He really cared about his students and their grades. However, you need to study very independently for the exams. Also, GO TO CLASS. Most of it is participation. I would recommend him.

I thought Brandon was a perfect combination of fun and serious. He tries to keep class lighthearted and doesn't get too upset if you don't always speak Spanish, but he also makes sure you're participating and lets you know if you say something incorrectly. I can definitely say that I understand spoken Spanish much better after taking his class.

I went in expecting to hate this class, but Brandon made the 5:30-7:30 pm lecture pretty enjoyable. He's funny, relatable, and easy to converse with. Coursework is neither hard nor time-consuming. Tests aren't that difficult as long as you know the material. There's no curve but that's a department rule that he has no control over.
Brandon makes every lecture memorable with the jokes you wish your professors told. All you have to do is know enough Spanish to get them and you should be good to go.
Great class. Made Spanish fun.
